role: Head of Cinema, Documentary and International Department
name: Fabrice Puchault
background: Fabrice Puchault serves as Head of Cinema, Documentary and International Department at ARTE France. Focus areas: Documentary films, international co-productions. They are looking for: Feature-length docs with strong artistic vision; international co-productions with cultural significance; creative approaches. Overall network strategy: ARTE France seeks intellectually stimulating, culturally enriching documentary and specialist factual content with European relevance that pushes creative boundaries while maintaining high artistic and intellectual standards.
thematic_priorities: Feature-length docs with strong artistic vision
Premium documentary content with European cultural relevance
Creative documentary approaches that push boundaries
Cultural documentaries exploring European identity and perspectives
Social documentaries with intellectual depth and artistic treatment
Historical documentaries with fresh intellectual perspectives
Science documentaries combining intellectual depth with visual innovation
Arts documentaries on major cultural figures or movements
target_audience: Culturally engaged audiences in France and Europe
budget_parameters: Documentary: €200K–€400K per hour; Specialist Factual: €220K–€450K per hour
technical_requirements: Subtitles/captions; audio description per broadcaster requirements
submission_process: 3–5 page treatment with premise, approach and artistic vision
additional_info: Increasing focus on distinctive voices and cross-platform reach; emphasis on diverse voices on- and off-screen; encouragement of sustainable production practices; support for projects across French regions.
